intro: Uvaria schizocalyx, commonly known as the fragrant uvaria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are arranged in clusters, attracting various pollinators. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, round seeds.
